data.title: Who Is The Most Famous Fox In The World?
data.meta_description: Over 80 fans have voted on the 60+ people on Who Is The Most Famous Fox In The World?. Current Top 3: Michael J. Fox, Megan Fox, James Fox
data.text:
Ranked By

414 votes

85 voters

Voting Rules

Vote up everyone you recognize with the last name Fox.

How many celebrities with the last name Fox can you think of? The famous Foxes below have many different professions, including notable actors with the last name Fox, famous musicians named Fox, and even athletes named Fox.

Michael J. Fox is certainly one of the most famous Foxes on this list. One of the famous actors with the last name Fox, he is best known for starring in Family Ties, Back to the Future, and Spin City. He was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in 1991, and founded the Michael J. Fox Foundation to help find a cure in 2000.

Another of the famous people with the last name Fox is Vivica A. Fox. She is an actress who started her career on soap operas. She went on to appear in Independence Day, Set It Off, and Kill Bill.

Did we forget one of your favorite famous people with the last name Fox? Just add them to the list. Then be sure to vote up every celebrity with the surname Fox that you've heard of!

Birthplace : Edmonton, Alberta, Canada

Michael J. Fox, a name synonymous with talent, resilience, and humanitarianism, was born on June 9, 1961, in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. He discovered his love for acting at a young age, and by the time he was 15, Fox was already starring in a successful Canadian television series called Leo and Me. His desire to reach greater heights propelled him to move to Los Angeles in 1979, where he landed the role of Alex P. Keaton in the popular sitcom Family Ties. This breakthrough role not only catapulted Fox into the limelight but also earned him three consecutive Emmy Awards. The late 1980s saw Fox expand his repertoire with a string of box office hits including the iconic Back to the Future trilogy, where he played the unforgettable character Marty McFly. Despite his swift rise to stardom, Fox's life took an unexpected turn when he was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in 1991 at the age of 29. However, instead of letting this debilitating condition dictate his life, Fox used it as a platform to bring about change. In 2000, he established The Michael J. Fox Foundation, which has since raised over $800 million for Parkinson's research. Fox's indomitable spirit is evident not only in his acting career but also in his personal life. He continued to work in film and television, receiving numerous accolades including five Primetime Emmy Awards, four Golden Globe Awards, and two Screen Actors Guild Awards. His memoirs, including Lucky Man and Always Looking Up, provide a candid look at his journey, further solidifying his status as an inspiration. Undeniably, Michael J. Fox's contribution to the entertainment industry, coupled with his relentless advocacy for Parkinson's research, has left an indelible mark that transcends beyond his roles on screen.

Birthplace : Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA

Megan Fox, widely recognized for her striking beauty and talent in acting, has left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry. Born Megan Denise Fox on May 16, 1986, in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, she displayed a flair for performance at an early age. She pursued training in dance and drama at just five years old and began modeling at thirteen after winning multiple awards at the American Modeling and Talent Convention. Fox's acting career took off when she made her film debut in the teen comedy "Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen" alongside Lindsay Lohan. However, it was her role as Mikaela Banes in the blockbuster movie "Transformers" that catapulted her to international fame. The success of this science fiction action film led to its sequel "Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen," further cementing Fox's position as a sought-after Hollywood actress. Despite facing criticism and controversy throughout her career—particularly around objectification issues—Fox continued to prove herself as more than just a pretty face by showcasing depth and versatility through various roles across different genres. From playing comedic parts like Jennifer Check in "Jennifer's Body" to voicing characters such as Lois Lane in television series like Robot Chicken”, Megan Fox has proven time-and-again that she is both adaptable on screen while remaining steadfastly committed to carving out her unique path within cinema's landscape.

Birthplace : Cardiff, United Kingdom

James Richard Mullett (born 6 April 1976), known professionally as James Fox, is a Welsh pop singer, songwriter, pianist and guitarist. He represented the United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 2004 in Istanbul. In 2008 he wrote and recorded the Cardiff City F.C. FA Cup Final song, "Bluebirds Flying High".

Birthplace : Argentina

Alex Fox (born October 18, 1953) is a guitarist. Fox was born and raised in Buenos Aires, Argentina, where he was inspired by a broad range of artists ranging from The Beatles to The Gipsy Kings. Fox later received a scholarship to train with the director of the Teatro Colón Symphony Orchestra, an opportunity which signaled the start of his career as a conductor, teacher and composer. It was during this time that Fox honed his own unique style which blended, according to his official biography, "classical rumba Fox moved to Miami Florida, United States, in 1981 where he quickly established himself as a noted local artist in the South Beach area. In the 1990s, Alex's performances at the Breakerwater Hotel, South Beach, were so popular that the crowds stopped traffic.His first album, To The Gypsies, was an independent production under his own label, Coco Musical, Inc. The album met with critical and commercial success worldwide, leading to the release of six more albums. Highlights of his career include: A performance for US President Bill Clinton in 1997 Work as a session musician on the Julio Iglesias release, La Carretera Opening act at the Istanbul Amphitheatre in 1999 for Tito Puente Featured act at the 2000 Bacardi Jazz Festival in BeirutFox's latest endeavor is the formation of the Fox Trio, featuring his sons Sebastian and David.

Hugo Fox (born February 2, 1897 in South Whitley, Indiana; died December 29, 1969 in South Whitley, Indiana) was an American classical bassoonist. He also designed and manufactured bassoons and oboes. Fox studied the bassoon with Adolph Weiss, a member of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra. In 1921, he studied with Walter Guetter, the principal bassoonist of the CSO. The following year, he took over Guetter's post, at his recommendation, and remained in that capacity from 1922 to 1949. He also taught at Northwestern University from 1936 to 1950. In 1949, Fox founded the Fox Products Corporation, which made bassoons and oboes. The company is a supplier of double reed instruments. His son, Alan Fox, was a founding member of the International Double Reed Society. In 1979, the International Double Reed Society created the annual Fernand Gillet-Hugo Fox International Competition for oboists and bassoonists in honor of the oboist Fernand Gillet and Hugo Fox.

Birthplace : Worcester, MA

Joslyn Fox (born July 27, 1986) is the stage name of Patrick Joslyn, an American drag performer best known for being a contestant on Season 6 of RuPaul's Drag Race, and placing 6th.
